info.description:
# Introduction
This API is documented in **OpenAPI 3.0 format**.

This API allowst the following operations:
* retrieve a list of the last 10 identifications
* retrieve profile data of a client's identification
* download media captured during identification
* upload documents for signing
* download signed documents
* receive webhooks notifications regarding identification state changes

# Basics
* API calls have to be secured with HTTPS.
* All data has to be submitted UTF-8 encoded.
* The reply is sent JSON encoded.

# Authentication
**verify-u** API uses Basic Authentication with secret key as username only.

Detailed information is provided at [Authentication](authentication)
info.title: verify-u API

get.description: Returns the latest identifications as a list. Most recent identifications appear first. Customize your query with the following parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of identifications to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the identifications to be returned. Default is 0.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
When set, only identifications of this status are returned. Default is `init`.
  * `init` - Identification has been initially started
  * `id_verified` - Id document check completed
  * `f2f_verified` - Face-to-face check completed
  * `face_detected` - Face check completed
  * `liveness_detected` - Liveness check completed
  * `schufa_ident_verified` - Schufa ident check completed
  * `schufa_bank_verified` - Schufa bank check completed
  * `esign_verified` - E-sign document signed
  * `complete` - Identification has been completed successfully

address.description: The client's address in format provided by ID document

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created in notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6

date_of_birth.description: The client's date of birth as represented in MRZ of ID document

id_document.description: Front side of the ID document

country.description: Country which issued this ID document

expiration_date.description: Date at which this ID document expires

issue_date.description: Date at which this ID document was issued

mrz.description: The 'machine-readable zone' entry of this ID document

number.description: The number of this ID document

issuer.description: MRZ Issuing country or organization(ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code with modifications)

nationality.description: MRZ nationality (ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code with modifications)

get.description: Returns the client's id document image used for identification.

200.description: ID document image in JPG format

get.description: Returns the client's audit document image created during identification.

200.description: Audit document image in JPG format

get.description: Returns the client's liveness video recording used for identification.
Returns the client's contract document, signed by the customer with digital signature.

200.description: Signed contract document in PDF format

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created in notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6

reference_id.description: Reference ID of the Schufa call

post.description:
Transfers a contract document PDF to be signed by the client.

 Store the returned `document_id` and append it to the identification request for the corresponding client.

get.description: Returns the state of the primary queue for F2F identification

agent_count.description: Number of agent currently serving F2F queue

customer_count.description: Number of customers currently standing in F2F queue

post.description: Creates a Schufa call for a client.
Updates to the state of identification during customer journey will be sent to your [webhook endpoint](https://docs.verify-u.com/webhooks).

client_reference_id.description: Client reference id extracted from OAuth `state` parameter when the latter is in format `[CLIENT_REFERENCE_ID]:[SESSION_ID]`. If no `SESSION_ID` separator is used, the entire `state` parameter is returned.

session_id.description: Session id extracted from OAuth `state` parameter when the latter is in format `[CLIENT_REFERENCE_ID]:[SESSION_ID]`

event_description.description: Additional commentary that we may add describing the cause of event
event_description.example: F2F session could not be established due to bad connection

200.description:
Your server must return OK HTTP response if it accepts the webhook request. Any other response will trigger
multiple subsequent retries until receipt of a successful response.
